label: A3B2_hP5_164_ad_d-001
title: Al$_{3}$Ni$_{2}$ ($D5_{13}$) Structure
comments:
Either the three Al atoms or Al (1a) and the Ni atoms form a \href{current_web_home_dir/AB2_hP3_164_a_d-001}{trigonal omega ($C6$) structure}. Using the choices of internal parameters for Al$_{3}$Ni$_{2}$, this can be viewed as a five-layer close-packed unit cell with stacking ABCBCA. 
 Al$_{3}$Ni$_{2}$ is isostructural with \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B3_hP5_164_d_ad-001}{La$_{2}$O$_{3}$ ($D5_{2}$)} and \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B2C_hP5_164_d_d_a-002}{Ce$_{2}$O$_{2}$S}.  We use this structure for the binary intermetallics, $D5_{2}$ for the binary oxides and related structures, and Ce$_{2}$O$_{2}$S for the ternary structures.
